author: Stacey Matthews
title: Anti-Israel Radicals Try Hijacking Christmas, Falsely Declare ‚ÄòJesus Was a Palestinian‚Äô
text: [ Anti-Israel Radicals Try Hijacking Christmas, Falsely Declare ‚ÄòJesus Was a Palestinian‚Äô](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/12/anti-israel-radicals-try-hijacking-christmas-falsely-declare-jesus-was-a-palestinian/) ‚ÄúOverheard: Shoutout to all the Christians who‚Äôve remained completely silent about the Palestinian genocide while they get ready to celebrate the birth of their favorite Palestinian man‚Äù [3 Comments](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/12/anti-israel-radicals-try-hijacking-christmas-falsely-declare-jesus-was-a-palestinian/#comments) While it‚Äôs not uncommon [for them](https://legalinsurrection.com/2018/12/once-again-anti-israel-activists-hijack-and-weaponize-christmas/) to try and [hijack](https://legalinsurrection.com/2015/12/guide-to-how-anti-israel-activists-hijack-christmas/) and [exploit](https://legalinsurrection.com/2017/12/palestinians-exploit-christmas-for-anti-trump-protests/) the Christmas holiday [season](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/11/anti-israel-protesters-disrupt-christmas-tree-lighting-in-ypsilanti-michigan/), wait until you get a load of what anti-Israel radicals are declaring during protests and on social media ahead of Christmas. It‚Äôs an argument they‚Äôve been pushing for years, that Jesus, who was Jewish, allegedly ‚Äúwas a Palestinian.‚Äù Below, you‚Äôll see several tweets as well as videos taken from recent pro-Palestinian marches where protesters are being urged to chant ‚ÄúJesus was a Palestinian‚Äù: "JESUS WAS A PALESTINIAN!" Toronto anti-Israel protesters chant as they call to cancel Christmas in Canada. They then wish for a Palestinian new year. [https://t.co/cIlPZDLUTt]to sign the petition. [pic.twitter.com/Cw3KtnlO57] ‚Äî Efrain Flores Monsanto üá®üá¶üöõ (@realmonsanto) [December 23, 2023] Christmas in Canada. [pic.twitter.com/dxfVPp4o9V] ‚Äî Catch Up (@CatchUpFeed) [December 17, 2023] Did you know the Prophet Jesus was a Palestinian? Yup, it's true! ‚Äî Robert Carter (@Bob_cart124) [December 20, 2023] Overheard: Shoutout to all the Christians who've remained completely silent about the Palestinian genocide while they get ready to celebrate the birth of their favorite Palestinian man ‚Äî Mohamad Safa (@mhdksafa) [December 21, 2023] üáµüá∏üè¥HAPPENING NOW! On the weekend of the Christmas eve, protesters are marching in Cardiff to draw attention to the lives being lost every day in Palestine, as Israel continues its military actions in Gaza. üì∏ "Jesus was a Palestinian" banner from today's march [pic.twitter.com/gbEcdGxKOB] ‚Äî voice.wales (@voice_wales) [December 23, 2023] As Christmas comes upon us, let us remember that Jesus was a Palestinian refugee and many of you Zionists who will be celebrating his birthday would be celebrating his being bombed if he were born today. Amen ü•∞ ‚Äî there‚Äôs some ho ho ho‚Äôs in this house (@realdocv) [December 19, 2023] The "Jesus was a Palestinian" propaganda line was coined by none other than Yasir Arafat, at a 1981 news conference. [pic.twitter.com/4lXZ08UmkI] ‚Äî Elder of Ziyon üáÆüá± (@elderofziyon) [December 22, 2023] Not surprisingly, there has been a ton of pushback on this preposterous claim: He himself referred to the land he lived in as 'Israel' in the Gospels. That fact alone should adjourn the court. ‚Äî Loay Alshareef ŸÑÿ§Ÿä ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ŸäŸÅ (@lalshareef) [December 21, 2023] Jesus was NOT A Palestinian 1. Jesus was a Jew from Judea. Born in Bethlehem a town in Judea=land of the Jews. 2. The Last Supper was the Jewish Passover 3. The word Palestine was coined years after Jesus‚Äô death. To this date there has never been a state called Palestine.‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Irish Jewish Voice (@Irishchutzpah) [December 22, 2023] I see more and more people falsely claim that [#Jesus]was a Palestinian. They appropriate Jewish history, and create a fake Palestinian history primarily because they want to erase Jewish connection to the land. Here are the facts: ‚Äì Jesus was a Jew, and throughout his entire‚Ä¶ [https://t.co/Q6v4uba9B4] ‚Äî Ron S. Friedman (@RonSFriedman) [December 20, 2023] More ‚ÄúPro-Palestine‚Äù protesters spouting out the false claim that Jesus ( a Jew born in Bethlehem and whose earthly body died long before the Romans made up the name ‚ÄúPalestina‚Äù) was Palestinian. Can‚Äôt a kid in Canada get a picture on Santa‚Äôs knee in peace anymore? [https://t.co/wZe9YCKdFE] ‚Äî Drea Humphrey ‚Äì Prepping and Politics (@DreaHumphrey) [December 17, 2023] When you see a post saying that Jesus was a Palestinian, remind them of the Quran, which acknowledges Jesus (Isa in Arabic) as an Israelite prophet. Jesus is referred to as a prophet sent specifically to the Children of Israel in Surah Al-Imran (3:49). ‚Äî LL Blue üá∫üá∏‚ú°Ô∏èüíôüáÆüá±üá∫üá¶üíô (@Dr_No_Know) [December 20, 2023] I admit this is not my area of expertise. Because my dad knew his stuff on this topic, I‚Äôve understood since I was a teenager that Jesus was Jewish, but I didn‚Äôt know much about the history of the land/region at the time. At Honest Reporting, Jerusalem-based writer Emanuel Miller explained [the complexities](https://honestreporting.com/jesus-was-jew-not-palestinian/) in-depth: Jesus was born in Judea, a client kingdom of the Roman Empire, and identified as a Jew. Jews living there at the time would most likely have described themselves as living in the Land of Israel. Anyone referring to ‚ÄúPalestine‚Äù in the first century C.E. would have earned themselves strange look, especially from the indigenous Aramaic-speaking Jews. The land was subject to all the religious laws in Judaism that apply in Land of Israel. A century later, the area was renamed. After a Jewish revolt was crushed in the 2nd Century CE, the vast majority of Jews were exiled and the Roman emperor Hadrian subsequently had the region entitled ‚ÄúSyria Palestina‚Äù after the Jews‚Äô ancient enemies, the Philistines, in an antagonistic move designed to demonstrate that the Jews were no longer owners of the land. Put simply, an Aramaic-speaking Jew living a century before this change of name would never have called himself Palestinian. Indeed, while the New Testament mentions Israel and the Jews repeatedly, Palestine is not mentioned even once. Jordan Cope, who is the director of policy education with the pro-Israel group ‚ÄúStandWithUs,‚Äù tackled the argument in an Jerusalem Post op-ed [published](https://www.jpost.com/opinion/article-779313) on Christmas Eve: In reality, Jesus was a proud, observant Jew who lived in his indigenous homeland of Judea and Galilee ‚Äì from manger to grave. The myth that Jesus was Palestinian, a ploy designed to invite Christians to support Palestinian nationalism, often morphs into deliberate efforts to deny Jews their history, indigeneity, and right to sovereignty in Israel. Ironically, as Jews seek to combat rising antisemitism, now might be a good time to set the record straight on Christianity‚Äôs most important figure. [‚Ä¶] The term Palestine derives from Philistia after the land of the Philistines, a people originally from the Aegean coastline (modern-day Greece and Turkey). Goliath was defeated and the Philistines disappeared centuries before Jesus was born. After Imperial Rome defeated the third Jewish uprising, Roman forces massacred and expelled massive numbers of Jews from Judea and renamed it: Syria Palaestina. This was in 135 CE, over a century after Jesus‚Äôs death (sometime around 27-33 CE). The new name was ‚Äúto minimize Jewish identification with the land‚Äù and punish the rebellious Jews by naming the country after their biblical enemies. As evidenced by the Romans, the erasure of Jewish memory, identity, and culture from Israel has become a mainstay tactic for antisemites over millennia. Even the New York Times of all places had to issue a correction in 2019 to an [op-ed](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/19/reader-center/jesus-images.html) published around Easter that [falsely claimed](https://www.foxnews.com/us/new-york-times-correction-jesus-palestinian-op-ed) Jesus ‚Äúmost likely‚Äù was Palestinian: The op-ed, titled ‚ÄúAs a Black Child in Los Angeles, I Couldn‚Äôt Understand Why Jesus Had Blue Eyes,‚Äù read: ‚ÄúJesus, born in Bethlehem, was most likely a Palestinian man with dark skin.‚Äù The New York Times issued the correction one week after it ran the story and received a barrage of criticism. ‚ÄúBecause of an editing error, an article last Saturday referred incorrectly to Jesus‚Äôs background,‚Äù the Times wrote. ‚ÄúWhile he lived in an area that later came to be known as Palestine, Jesus was a Jew who was born in Bethlehem.‚Äù It was changed to: ‚ÄúBut Jesus, a Jew born in Bethlehem, presumably had the complexion of a Middle Eastern man.‚Äù In short, saying ‚ÄúJesus was a Palestinian‚Äù is a lot like the ‚Äú [from the river to the sea](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/11/rashida-tlaib-gaslights-on-from-the-river-to-the-sea-gruesome-nova-festival-footage-proves-shes-lying/)‚Äù chant. It‚Äôs anti-Semitic to the core, and it deserves a sound debunking every time it is uttered. ‚Äî Stacey Matthews has also written under the pseudonym ‚ÄúSister Toldjah‚Äù and can be reached via [](https://legalinsurrection.com/subscribe/) [DONATE](https://raisedonors.com/legalinsurrectionfoundation/general) Donations tax deductible to the full extent allowed by law.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Public urinator arrested for slashing throat of church caretaker in the East Village
text: NEW YORK (1010 WINS/WCBS 880) ‚Äì A man was arrested for slashing the throat of a church caretaker who asked him to stop urinating on a car in the East Village, police said Friday. Roberto Ortiz, 28, was nabbed Thursday in the East Village and charged with attempted murder, assault, criminal possession of a weapon, criminal possession of a controlled substance, and false personation. His address is listed as a men's shelter on the Bowery. Police believe Ortiz is the man behind the brutal slashing at East 14th Street and First Avenue on the evening of Jan. 21. The victim‚Äîa 54-year-old man who works as a caretaker at the Immaculate Conception Church‚Äîwas outside the church on East 14th Street at 5 p.m. when he saw a man urinating on a car. When he asked the man to stop, the man whipped out a box cutter and slashed him across the neck, police said. The victim was rushed in critical condition to Mount Sinai Beth Israel, where he received 16 stitches to his neck. The victim later told the New York Post that he decided to confront the man when he saw him urinating on a church wall. "I can‚Äôt let that happen," the victim said. The attacker went into a rage and started shouting obscenities at him before cutting his throat. "I just felt something hot coming down my neck, then I realized I had blood all over my body," he said. There have been several reports in recent weeks of public urinators attacking people who confronted them. An NYPD officer was injured in Inwood on Jan. 22 by a man who drove a car at officers who'd caught him urinating in public. And in the West Village on Feb. 14, a man was stabbed in the stomach by a man who he'd asked to stop urinating on a building in the middle of the afternoon, police said.

author: Bruce Campbell | Enid News & Eagle
title: Plainsmen swimmers win confernce; girls 2nd
text:
EDMOND, Okla. ‚Äî Taylor Higbee won four gold medals and Hudson Plummer three as the Enid Plainsmen reclaimed the Oklahoma Big Seven Conference swimming championships Thursday, Jan. 23, 2025, at the Mitch Park YMCA.
Enid‚Äôs girls, seeking their 10th straight conference title, were second to Ponca City.

title: Nana Caymmi faz mais uma cirurgia em hospital no Rio
text:
Nana Caymmi faz mais uma cirurgia em hospital no Rio
A cantora e compositora Nana Caymmi faz mais uma cirurgia em hospital no Rio; ela est√° internada no hospital h√° 4 meses
Nana Caymmi, √≠cone da m√∫sica brasileira, continua internada na Casa de Sa√∫de S√£o Jos√©, no Rio de Janeiro, onde enfrenta um processo de recupera√ß√£o delicado. Aos 83 anos, a cantora est√° passando por um desmame da traqueostomia realizada recentemente. A interven√ß√£o, que cria uma abertura na traqueia para facilitar a respira√ß√£o, √© parte do tratamento ap√≥s complica√ß√µes respirat√≥rias enfrentadas pela artista.
De acordo com o boletim m√©dico divulgado nesta quinta-feira (19), Nana est√° est√°vel, mas ainda sem previs√£o de alta. Al√©m do desmame, a cantora passa por reabilita√ß√£o fisioter√°pica e fonoaudiol√≥gica, essenciais para sua recupera√ß√£o. "Ela est√° em um per√≠odo de interna√ß√£o prolongada para realizar reabilita√ß√£o e o processo de desmame da traqueostomia", afirmou o comunicado da institui√ß√£o.
ARTISTA EST√Å INTERNADA DESDE JULHO
A hospitaliza√ß√£o de Nana come√ßou no final de julho, quando foi diagnosticada com arritmia card√≠aca. A condi√ß√£o exigiu interna√ß√£o na Unidade Coronariana, seguida de uma cirurgia para implante de marca-passo no in√≠cio de agosto. Ap√≥s a alta, em 13 de agosto, a artista retornou ao hospital no dia 28 do mesmo m√™s para novos cuidados. Desde ent√£o, permanece sob supervis√£o m√©dica intensiva.
O procedimento para o implante do marca-passo foi essencial para corrigir sua arritmia e evitar complica√ß√µes futuras. A cirurgia, considerada de m√©dio porte, consistiu em inserir o dispositivo por uma pequena incis√£o no t√≥rax, conectando-o ao cora√ß√£o por meio de eletrodos. Apesar do sucesso do procedimento, a fragilidade da sa√∫de de Nana exigiu monitoramento cont√≠nuo e tratamentos complementares, incluindo a traqueostomia.
Filha do lend√°rio Dorival Caymmi e da cantora Stella Maris, Nana √© um dos nomes mais respeitados da m√∫sica brasileira, com uma carreira marcada por interpreta√ß√µes intensas e emocionantes. Seu estado de sa√∫de mobiliza f√£s e colegas de profiss√£o, que torcem por sua recupera√ß√£o.

author: GB Times
title: Did twitch always suffer from depression?
text:
Did Twitch Always Suffer from Depression?
Twitch, the popular live streaming platform, has been a major hub for gamers and esports enthusiasts. However, in recent years, the platform has faced numerous controversies and criticisms surrounding mental health, particularly depression. But did Twitch always suffer from depression? Let‚Äôs dive into the history of the platform and explore the answer to this question.
Early Days of Twitch
Twitch was founded in 2011 by Justin Kan and Emmett Shear, and it initially focused on live streaming video games. The platform quickly gained popularity, and by 2013, it had become the go-to destination for gamers to watch and interact with each other. During this period, the platform was relatively small, with a dedicated community of gamers and streamers.
The Rise of Twitch
As Twitch continued to grow, it became a major player in the gaming industry. In 2014, Amazon acquired the platform for $970 million, and it continued to expand its user base and offerings. The platform introduced new features, such as live streaming of music and art, and it became a major hub for esports and gaming events.
The Dark Side of Twitch
However, as Twitch grew in popularity, it also faced increasing criticism and controversy surrounding mental health, particularly depression. Many streamers and viewers began to speak out about the pressures and stresses of the platform, including the constant need to perform, the pressure to maintain a certain image, and the lack of support for mental health.
The Impact of Depression on Twitch
Studies have shown that the gaming industry, including Twitch, has a significant impact on mental health. A study by the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) found that gamers who played for more than 4 hours a day were more likely to experience depression and anxiety. Another study by the University of Oxford found that gamers who played for more than 6 hours a day were more likely to experience depression, anxiety, and sleep disturbances.
The Effects of Streaming on Mental Health
Streaming on Twitch can have a significant impact on mental health, particularly depression. Streaming can be a source of stress and anxiety , as streamers feel pressure to perform, maintain a certain image, and interact with their audience. The constant need to be "on" and entertaining can be exhausting and draining, leading to feelings of burnout and depression.
The Lack of Support for Mental Health
Despite the growing awareness of mental health issues, Twitch has been criticized for its lack of support for streamers and viewers. There is no dedicated mental health support system in place, and many streamers have reported feeling isolated and unsupported. The platform‚Äôs focus on entertainment and community has led to a lack of attention to mental health, and many streamers have spoken out about the need for more support and resources.
The Impact of Depression on Streamers
Depression can have a significant impact on streamers, including:
‚Ä¢ Loss of motivation : Depression can make it difficult for streamers to find the motivation to stream, leading to a decline in their streaming schedule and overall performance.
‚Ä¢ Decreased engagement : Depression can lead to a decrease in engagement with the audience, as streamers may feel overwhelmed or disconnected from their community.
‚Ä¢ Increased stress : Depression can increase stress and anxiety, leading to a decline in overall well-being and mental health.
Conclusion
In conclusion, while Twitch has always had a dedicated community of gamers and streamers, it has only recently faced significant criticism and controversy surrounding mental health, particularly depression. The platform‚Äôs lack of support for mental health has led to a growing awareness of the need for more resources and support for streamers and viewers. As the platform continues to grow and evolve, it is essential that it prioritizes mental health and provides a safe and supportive environment for all users.
Table: The Impact of Depression on Streamers
Effect
Description
Loss of motivation
Depression can make it difficult for streamers to find the motivation to stream, leading to a decline in their streaming schedule and overall performance.
Decreased engagement
Depression can lead to a decrease in engagement with the audience, as streamers may feel overwhelmed or disconnected from their community.
Increased stress
Depression can increase stress and anxiety, leading to a decline in overall well-being and mental health.
Bullets: The Need for Mental Health Support on Twitch
‚Ä¢ Dedicated mental health support system : Twitch needs a dedicated mental health support system in place to provide resources and support for streamers and viewers.
‚Ä¢ Increased awareness : Twitch needs to increase awareness of mental health issues and provide education and resources for streamers and viewers.
‚Ä¢ Reduced pressure to perform : Twitch needs to reduce the pressure to perform and entertain, and provide a more relaxed and supportive environment for streamers and viewers.
‚Ä¢ Increased support for streamers : Twitch needs to provide more support for streamers, including mental health resources, counseling, and therapy.

author: Helix Consulting LLC
title: Mother See condemns violence against Jerusalem Armenian community - Panorama | Armenian news
text: [Society](https://www.panorama.am/en/news/society)15:36 29/12/2023 Armenia Mother See condemns violence against Jerusalem Armenian community The Mother See of Holy Etchmiadzin issued a statement on Friday condemning the violence against the Armenian Patriarchate of Jerusalem and the local Armenian community. The full statement is provided below. "With deep concern, we learned about the ongoing provocative actions around the Cows' Garden estate belonging to the Armenian Patriarchate of Jerusalem. On December 28, more than three dozen armed men invaded the territory of Cows' Garden, carried out violent actions, as a result of which clergymen of the Patriarchate and members of the local Armenian community received various physical injuries. It is obvious that the provocateurs are once again trying to seize the Cows' Garden estate through terror, threats and violent actions, violating the procedures established by the law. Strictly condemning what happened, we hope that the Israeli authorities will respond legally to the criminal acts against the Patriarchate and the Armenian community, the culprits will be held accountable and the repetition of similar cases will be excluded. We express our support to the military Brotherhood of Saints Hakobyan of Jerusalem and the Armenian community, asking for God's help." author: Rhoda Noack
title: Nerves Problems And Diseases Medical Responses.
text:
Youngsters with childish convulsions, an unusual form of epileptic seizures, need to be treated with among three suggested treatments and using nonstandard therapies ought to be highly discouraged, according to a research of their efficiency by a Weill Cornell Medication and NewYork-Presbyterian private investigator and working together coworkers in the Pediatric Epilepsy Study Consortium. When kids that‚Äôre older than year have spells resembling infantile convulsions, they‚Äôre typically identified as epileptic spasms. Childish spasms are a kind of epilepsy that impact babies normally under 12 months old. After a spasm or series of spasms, your infant may appear upset or cry‚Äì yet not always.
An infantile spasm may occur because of a problem in a tiny part of your child‚Äôs mind or may be because of a much more generalized brain concern. If you believe your baby might be having infantile spasms, talk with their doctor as soon as possible.
There are several sources of childish spasms. Infantile spasms affect roughly 1 in 2,000 to 4,000 infants. Infantile convulsions (additionally called epileptic spasms) are a kind of epilepsy that occur to infants commonly under twelve month old. This graph can help you discriminate in between infantile convulsions and the startle response.
Children influenced by infantile spasms frequently currently have or later on have developmental hold-ups or developmental regression. Try to take video clips of your youngster‚Äôs convulsions so you can reveal them to their pediatrician It‚Äôs really crucial that infantile spasms are identified early if you can.
Childish spasms last around one to 2 seconds in a collection; whereas various other sorts of seizures can last from 30 seconds to 2 minutes. It‚Äôs essential to see their health care provider as quickly infant convulsions causes as possible if your baby is experiencing convulsions. Brain injuries or infections: Virtually any sort of brain injury can create childish convulsions.
Childish spasms. A child can have as several as 100 convulsions a day. Infantile spasms are most usual just after your baby gets up and rarely take place while they‚Äôre resting. Epilepsy is a group of neurological problems identified by uncommon electrical discharges in your mind.
A childish spasm may take place due to an abnormality in a tiny portion of your kid‚Äôs brain or may be because of a much more generalised brain concern. If you believe your baby may be having childish spasms, talk to their doctor asap.
